Habe das Spiel 1 Tag gespielt als es übers Wochenende umsonst war.

Pros:
- kompetetiver Faktor
- Gänsehautfeeling
- neuartiges Gameplay

Cons:
- keine zeitgemäße Grafik
- noch sehr buglastig
- wird eventuell schnell zu eintönig (?)

Fazit: Für den Preis werd ichs mir trotzdem kaufen da es ziemlich Laune macht.

Pros: 
Each survivor and killer has a different play style. 
Leveling up is pretty easy
Devs are quick to fix issues.


Cons: 
You will sometimes play against people that are of a much higher level/rank

Edit: 
New Pro: This game has gotten even better. More killers and more survivors.
New Con: To a survivor, if you are ON THE MAP while they are hooked, you are camping.

First of all, this game is great. The concept is revolutionnary, the survivors and killers are well balanced, sorry for the haters, and one round will never be the same as another one.
The devs are great, they communicate on updates and what they're trying to achieve, and the community is also good.
But please, pretty please, dear devs, FIX THE MATCHMAKING !!!!!!! Most of the time, after pressing "Join a Lobby" several times, you'll find a game rather quickly. But sometimes, and that's why I'm putting this review now, you'll keep pressing this button for AN HOUR, and no games at all will pop up. And this is not the first time since the last update.

Once fixed, buy this game eyes closed if you like that sort of game.

Game is okay, balance is okay, Problems with matchmaking. 
Has ranking and denys any progression playing private matches.
Matchmaking is a fumble, constantly lack of players, wait times in the hours at times.
Weirdness when matchmaking in a party. Continual need to press "ready" button everytime it doesnt find anything. 

Matchmaking is not balanced, so dont expect a fair fight, but that being said, even with nothing you can win.

Overall an okay and playable game, would not recommend as some issues need resolving.
got on discount for $16USD Currently in a $10USD state. Fun in private, bad in casual.

Would recommend DEV's add the same progreeeion levels/upgrades for private matches, BUT have them seperate. As trying to play Casual to level up tends to be problematic.
haven't played it enough to give it a proper review

I LOVED THIS GAME SO MUCH!!!!! I only played the free version and it was SO MUCH FUN!!!!!! I am definetly going to buy this game, and the best thing about this is that it never rly gets boring! I could acually spend a whole day on this, also, I think it was a very smart idea that you can play with your friends!! I could go on and on about this game but lets just say this is one of the best games ever. I definetly recommend others to try this game.

Świetna gra dająca naprawdę wiele zabawy i potrafi na początku nawet przestraszyć. Grafika jest na dość wysokim poziomie. Często zdarzają się drobne błędy. Bardzo podoba mi się zamysł gry, jej oryginalność. Cieszy mnie też to, że twórcy ciągle udoskonalają swoją grę i słuchają się opinii graczy. Często gra jest aktualizowana o nowe zawartości i przy okazji usuwane są błędy. Gorąco polecam, szczególnie jeżeli macie grupę osób, z którymi moglibyście razem pograć. Jeżeli nawet takowej nie macie, to prawdopodobnie ją znajdziecie podczas gry.

Доброго времени суток всем кто читает этот обзор.Начнём с того что это вобщем очень хорошая игрушка. Подойдёт тем кто хочет поиграть в хорроры но не готов к таким как Outlast или DOOM. Так же присутствует интересная система прокачки персов. Ну а если вы решите поиграть с друзьями то я вам могу гарантировать мнООООГго эмоций, веселья и приятных воспоминаний!! Так что берите - не пожалеете!

Помойка
Despite the bugs and issues, this game is a fantastic time.

Good: Core gameplay is very entertaining. Either as killer or survivor, the hi-deand-seek gameplay keeps you engaged and on your toes throughout the match. The game is a good mix of scary & fun. If you have a few friends who like these kind of horor games, it's great to play for a few hours together, either with one of you as the killer or with a random killer. Community, so far, has been generally welcoming and players generally give you helpful tips if you ask. There is a discord server avalaible to anyone who wnats to find people to play with, and this has greatly improved my experience with the game.

Bad: Survivor gameplay has a much, much steeper learning curve and so initial games as survivor tend to be frustrating as you can get hooked easily. Included tutorials are very basic as well. Game is definitely indie and doesn't have a lot of polish in some areas - harmless visual bugs such as clipping throguh a generator, hanging too the side of a hook, or appearing to loose a pip (for ranking) when you actually haven't are relatively common. Some more general imbalances at the time of writing, such as a silly killer hit distance, may bug you if you want to go on to a higher level of play. No servers so the killer is always host which can lead to some really buggy games (pro tip: you can check lag via the chatbox in the starting lobby and bail without penatly then if you need to)

Overall: I recommend for casual play, if you are willing to put the time in to learn how to survive or to play a lot with friends. If you are the kind of person who will want to get the highest rank you can and be the best survivor/killer may be frustrated with some questionable balance desisions made by the devs.

Dead by Daylight is an asymetric multiplayer horror survival game. One of four killers tries to find and sacrifice four people before they can reactivate a number of generators and open the gate to their safe escape.

Killers and survivors are rewarded points for pretty much any action they take during each round. Examples are healing an ally, sneaking by the killer, looting helpful items, or in the case of the killer, injuring survivors, impaling them on hooks, and many other things.

These points are used to level up, which means receiving consumable items as well as permanent perks that add another layer of strategy on this game, which already has a fairly high skill ceiling (since I've only played this game for four hours, this part only comes from me watching streams of people who have hundreds of hours in it.)

I've only started playing this game during the free weekend. It's a lot of fun, and if it was completely balanced and polished I'd even consider buying it for two or three times the current price (20€/17€ during the free weekend)

However, it is not, which is the reason why my recommendation is to wait with buying for the next few patches. The devs seem to be very active because they apparently fixed a recent problem with finding lobbies during this weekend. They've also informed the players via twitter of other bug fixes they'll be working on on monday (tomorrow). Now some of you may say that is the least the devs should be doing, but sadly, as some of you may have experienced, it is not.
Decent game not sure its worth 14.99 though
Very entertaining when play with friends

2021.02.12重新評價
史上最爛改版，動作的反饋變得很不直覺，生存者下板，殺手會被吸過去另邊，我自己玩殺手都受不了。

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

周末免費玩的活動後便上鉤了，決定購入
外掛還是有，但官方有在抓，碰到的機率也不大，剩下的是人品問題防不勝防
遊戲具有難度與隨機性（你不知道會是哪張地圖及所面對殺手的實力），一再的挫敗能夠激發鑽研的決心
rank制度的設計很好地鼓勵了互助行為，避免遊戲陷入各顧性命的僵局，也避免失望的玩家離開
被詬病的倖存者間不能對話溝通，其實是具有巧思的設計，一方面是擬真且使遊戲中的能力具有意義，
一方面也照顧了找不到朋友玩的玩家，且各國玩家之間不受語言限制共樂，可把林子做大，這根本是優點才對
產商有在思考

一場遊戲不會太久，節奏快，以及重要的隨機性，使人不知不覺一場接一場
每個角色都有獨特性，會讓人想一一練功，當殺手當倖存者都好玩
後續應該還有很多擴充的空間，造型服裝更多新角色新地圖等等
加上廠商有在動腦思考，包括平衡，包括國際主義路線，包括獎勵玩家做出使整體遊戲體驗更佳的行為
我認為這款遊戲的發展可以期待


缺點：Dwight（隊長）能力做太弱了，生存能力差其他角色太遠，推薦給高手高手高高手使用。

Ich habe das Testwochenende gespielt. Von mir gibt es eine ganz klare Kaufempfehlung. Das Spiel ist einfach Spitze. Tolle Idee die super umgesetzt wurde . Die negativ Kommentare kann ich nicht nachvollziehen. Im Koop, mit Freunden den Killer überleben ist einfach geil. Für 20 € wird hier einem wirklich sehr sehr viel Spielspass geboten.

Macht mir viel Spaß, viele Fehler wurden inzwischen behoben. Leider muss man auch sagen, ist das Spiel nicht fehlerfrei aber welches Spiel ist perfekt? Vor kurzem wurde das Spiel mit dem Charakter "Bill" aus Left 4 Dead erweitert und man vermutet, ob es sich bei dem nächsten Killer vielleicht um ein Spezial Zombie aus L4D handelt. Die Entwickler antworteten auf die Frage, ob sie sich Zombies als Killer vorstellen könnten mit: "Never say never!" 

Dead by Daylight ist ein schwieriges Spiel für Anfänger, wenn du also mal als Killer keinen Überlebenden kriegst. 
Denk immer daran, dass es das Ziel und die Aufgabe eines jeden Überlebenden ist, zu entkommen! 

Solltest du mal als Überlebender das Problem haben und kommst relativ früh auf einer der Haken. 
Denk immer daran, es ist die Aufgabe des Killers, dich zu kriegen und zu töten, daher lass dich niemals erwischen!

Mir macht das Spiel mittlerweile viel Spaß, daher kann ich es euch empfehlen.
Советую!
very good

Ich finde das Spiel gut (super wäre übertrieben)... Auch mit der Lobbysuche gehts schnell voran (gab ja Patches/Hotfixes wegen dem)...

Um was es im Spiel geht, könnt ihr gerne bei anderen comments reps. Spielbeschreibung nachschauen...

Am liebsten Spiele ich mit Freunden zusammen, aber auch das alleine spielen hat seinen Reiz.

Momentan gibt es einfach noch das Problem mit auto-aim (oder wie sich das schreibt)... man steht im 90% Winkel vom Killer, der schlägt, und zack, ist man getroffen. Oder der Killer schlägt durch die Wand. Dies muss unbedingt gefixt werden, ansonsten ist das entkommen sehr schwierig. 
Bei guten Killern, die den wirklich spielen können, ist es dann immer noch schwierig genug.

Im allgemeinen kann ich das Spiel nur weiterempfehlen, da zudem der Preis nicht hoch ist.
Hätten die Entwickler ein Budget wie z.B. bei GTA 5 gehabt und auch zu diesem Preis anbieten, hätte ich kein Verständnis für die Bugs etc.

I mean level 35 killers with level 2 survivors might not make much sense. Also the Daily Rituals in the game, as of me writing this, dont function properly. I have done two of the Rituals and not received any of the reward bloodpoints.

Played around 6 games today and died in 5 of them due to bugs.\

Hated it solo,

 loved it with atleast 2 friends, then it finally became really enjoyable. Except when you're always the one spawning next to the killer/dying first.

Match queueing simulator.

It would be a lot more fun if it wasn't always laggy as fuck thanks to P2P.

If I didn't have to search 25 times to get into one match.

If I didn't get kicked out of a lobby everytime I found a match.

Update 10/24/2021

Everything that use to be fun about the game is gone, you get hit 10-15 feet away consistently, through corners, around corners and after you've vaulted a pallet/window.

It's always day time, there's no fog or night time anymore (When it is night it's bright as hell).

All the good concepts were thrown out the window, the killers keep getting more OP with their increased speed and range or even AoE ontop of that, just makes the game unplayable.

SBMM just made matches even less fun, now that it's gen rush or lose. Most of my teammates spend 90% of the round hiding, doing nothing or walking away when I need a heal.

This is one of the few mutiplayer games I enjoy playing. I usually play singleplayer, but this game felt different, and more exciting, even though it's simple.

The game is fun to play, and you find yourself frustrated at times, and sometimes it's exciting and fun. 

The bad things about the game, is that it's buggy, and it hasn't that much to it yet. I find myself in weird screens when trying to join lobbies, and the game lags from time to time even though my computer can handle it pretty well. Still not something that isn't unplayable. Personally, I'd want more game modes and customization options, but I'm sure that will come later.  

I recomend it if you like this kind of game, and if you aren't too worried about bugs and lack of features. I like it for what it is right now. It's simple, and fun.

Признаться, когда я только узнал о выходе Dead by Daylight, я не собирался ее покупать, описание и ролик просто не зацепили, да и цена показалась завышенной. Оригинальная идея казалась невоплотимой, начиная от общей механики игры и заканчивая различными мелочами. Игру я купил по чистой случайности, друг уговорил, и ни чуть не пожалел о покупке.

В начале, честно говоря, было не по себе, я постоянно ходил вдоль стенки на корточках, побаивался маньяка и редко нормально мог попадать в мини-играх, но буквально через несколько часов игры ко многому привык, и даже маньяк перестал быть чем-то страшным. 

В игре приятная, качественная графика, при этом игра не слишком требовательная. Игровая механика не сложная, однако, что бы начать хорошо играть, придётся понять некоторые тонкости и изучить кое-какие основные тактики. Игра на удивление не приедается и не надоедает даже после многих часов геймплея (лично мне точно). Честно говоря, в игре еще есть некоторые шероховатости, однако разработчики активно трудятся над улучшением игры. Доказательствами этого могут служить стримы разработчиков (да и вообще их наличие) и часто выходящие патчи.

Итог: уникальная в своем роде игра, не имеющая пока что нормальных аналогов, с достойной графикой и приятным геймплеем. Подтверждением того, что игра хорошая и интересная, может стать активность сообщества проявленная к Dead by Daylight. Лично я, ничуть не жалею о недавней покупке, и хочу сказать, что игра полностью стоит своих денег.  :D
Игра великолееепна ; я готов ей обмазываться

Initial review at 23 hours in.  Will update how I feel as I progress (New Update as of 4/7 - general edits noted to show things the devs have fixed to indicate how this dev team is actively improving the game)

Diamond in the rough - VERY ROUGH.  

How to put this - the game core concept and most of it's mechanics are awesome.  But there is so much that needs to be addressed first because the issues it does have?  Completely rage-inducing.

Game has 5 players on 2 teams.  Their mechanics are as follows.

KILLER 
- Can't be killed
- is slightly faster than the survivors
- can down any survivor in 2 hits.
- can track sprinting survivors as sprinting leaves a trail for a period of time.  Wounded survivors also drop blood spatters that also fade, but can be followed.
- Locked into first person view with your FOV locked so that the survivors have a chance to break line of site and loose you.
- It's just you, versus 4 others.
- Your locked into a standing run.  You cannot crouch to make yourself harder to spot, and you cannot spiint.
- You have a slight aim assist on your swings, but this can be exploited if the survivors know what they're doing. (Taking hits for a wounded teammates - tricking the killer into hitting a tree with the swing, ect)

SURVIVORS
- Has 3rd person camera for better awareness.
- You have the advantage of numbers.
- When the killer is near you, you get a heartbeat that intensifies the closer the killer is.
- Less frustrating as a survivor as you climb through the ranks, early matches are tough.
- Your pretty much boned if your teammates won't work with you.
- Can leap through window sills faster than the killer can step through them.
- Can crouch and hide behind smaller obstacles.
- Can stun the killer by wiggling out his grasp, blind him with flashlights,sabatage most of his hooks, toss pallets in his way (or on him for the stun) which he must circumvent or take time destroying.

To get away from the killer, the survivors need to power up 5 of 7 generators spread throughout the proceedurally generated map.  Repairing them take some time and will randomly pop skill checks which are essentially QTE's.  Succeed in said event, you continue repairing.  Fail - the generator blows in a flash of light and the killer gets both an audio and visual alert from anywhere in the map (and some of your repair progress is lost)   Survivors can all assist on the generator, making the repair go faster -  but you will certainly who failed the QTE when it happens :)

Once the generators are powered up, the electric gates on the map power up (there's 2 of them for each map so the killer can't just camp it).  Gate takes a bit of time to open once you get to the switch and you still have another short run to get out after it's open.

If the killer manages to nab all the survivors but one, but the team manages to gotten at least 2 generators at that point, then a 3rd escape in the form of an escape hatch opens.  Said hatch makes a slight howling noise that can be heard from nearby.  Making said hatch it worth a lot of points, and some survivors seek them out even if they don't need to.

Killer on the otherhand must locate and nab each survivor.  You can either nab them in the middle of an action (such as repairing or jumping through a window) or just hit them 2 times.  You then toss them over your shoulder and bring them to sacrificial hooks dotted around the map.  Toss the survivor on a hook, and leave them to wait for a spider entity to eventually appear and kill them.

To cap it off - the game has a progression system that seems to reward giving a good chase rather than outright destroying your opponantes.  Indeed, it's possible for the killer to make bank in points without every killing any players outright.  Killers who figure this out stop camping hooks because they realize there's more progression for them if they let the victim get rescued so they can chase them around and down them again.  And survivors start doing risky things to get those extra boldness points around the killer.  Makes for a lively game when everybody is on the same page and actually gaming the system a little bit.

That being said - game does have issues.  There's times where buildings and windows that generate place windows and barriers such a way that it's virtually impossible for the killer to catch the survivor (**MORE OR LESS FIXED NOW - WITH MORE IMPROVEMENTS COMING**) - and some killers just don't "Get it" and will camp hooks which kills the fun for the person being camped (**DEVS ARE LOOKING TO CURB MORE SEVERE VERSIONS OF THIS, SOME OF THESE ARE NOW IN TESTING**).   Community has some real tards that will exploit that garbage going both ways and ruin your experience.  But occasionally they'll surprise you and you'll run into a killer who will down the last survivor, but then carry them to the exit and drop them as a kindness for a game well played.

Game is also very unforgiving to the new player (THIS IS THE GAME'S LARGEST FLAW) and can be really really unfair to them.  I don't suggest you pick this up if you hate starting at a disadvantage - because you WILL be placed with killers or survivors that have more unlocks and perks than you do.  If you can't handle that, please give it a pass.  Hopefully - that's something they'll eventually address.

Overall - I liked it enough to buy it for 16 bucks and I don't feel cheated so far.  Certainly not worth 30 bucks I'd say, but 15 or 20 is fair - especially since they've shown they are not adverse to adding new maps and killers for free.

Solid game - but frustrating to play at times.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

9/24/2016   50+ hours update

Community needs patching - because there is some seriously pissed off players out there.

There are a couple of issues this game needs to address

- Matchmaking (still the biggest issue - and the biggest hinderance to new players).  You won't get an even fight. (As of 4/7, still an issue)
- Once you break into the middle ranks, game gets really hard unless you have the meta perks.  So be prepared to derank often until you get those metaperks.  Personally I'm still finding my fun where I can.
- Hook Camping does need to be looked at.  I don't camp hooks as killer anymore and it's not hurting my score and it indeed makes the survivors a bit more willing to take chances around you and give those scoring opportunities.  I think the game would benefit from a system that would discourage the hook camp while keeping it a viable strat (sometimes there's just a player you NEED to remove from the game)

Overall, I still enjoy the game - but I see more of it's flaws now.  I'm willing to give them time though, still worth 20 bucks as far as I'm concerned.

OCT 23rd - 150 hours in-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Game is really a drag for the killer the higher up through the ranks you get.  But it seems the developers recognize this and are at least making noise that they are about to make some changes to address it.

It's funny, the game is easy as pie for the killer when you are first starting - the skill floor is lower for the killer.  But then the entire game flip-flops as both sides gain experience - and the Killer is severely hampred by his lower skill cieling.

it's somewhat mitgated by the fact that one or two of the killer's scale well with skill.  Nurse is easily the most powerful killer when in the hands of somebody good at the game - but getting to that point is a chore as her skill floor is higher than some killer's skill ceiling.

At any rate, game's toxic community and frustrating game play at the higher ranks is starting to take it's toll - but I'm not yet ready to revoke my recomendation.

-----------------------------------------------------

4/7 update - 3 new killers and survivors have been added to the game, another about to be released.

The game is a GREAT horror game!

To newcomers, please ignore *most* of the bad reviews. Focus on the reviews, good or bad, with people actually explaining their points without hyperbole. A very unfortunate thing about this game is the amount of haters who can't handle when something doesn't go their way, be it getting owned in game a couple of times, or an unfortunate bug that's not getting fixed now now NOW! You will hear far more from the haters and trolls than you will ever hear from those that genuinely love the game.

In a nutshell, the game is balanced, despite what some are saying. The complainers are people that have gotten owned 3 times by the same killer and changing tactics never even enters their minds. I've played games as survivor and as killer. I've played against good players and against not so good players. I've won matches and I've lost matches. Every killer and every survivor has their pros and cons. 

The game is a BLAST! Played right, it's extremely tense and scary as a survivor, and very satisfying as a killer. There are enough unique perks for each survivor to make them feel like they "fill a role" without feeling like they are out of balance one way or another. Killers are all unique in game play, and you'll find which are your favorites and which aren't. But, they are all balanced fine.

There are a couple of exploits, and it's not the devs' fault that asshats choose to exploit them. The major ones have been fixed. For the record, "camping a hook" (a favorite complaint from haters) is NOT an exploit, as it has pros and cons and is a valid strategy. I've won plenty of games where the killer camped a hook and killed one survivor while others have finished one, even two generators.

There have been bugs. Obviously, because it's a video game. The devs are active in working on them. The biggest issue was the wait time in the lobby, but this last patch has by and large fixed that, with a small few still having issues. Again, you're going to hear the vocal minority scream while those who are now happy with the game will rarely speak up.

This is actually my first game review, but I wanted to do it because it's such a fun game and I wanted people to know what a great game this is. The only really bad part of this game? The toxic whiners/haters who scream so loud that you can’t hear the people who have something legitimate to say.

Good luck in game!
нормас

My original review was negative due to features I felt the devs had neglected and exploits that had a very big impact on the game. 

They've largely fixed these issues and now I feel this game is deserving of my praise.  When first dead by daylight came out I was thrilled.  I love these types of games and I enjoyed Damned a big and am looking forward to the friday the 13th game.  Coming into this game I really enjoy the sense of dread and the difficulty of surviving.  Ideally you should enter the game expecting some people to die, it is based on the notion of a horror movie after all and escape should be hard.  Sometimes you can get a little frustrated with the game, but I think the sense of desperation is there and is key to the genre.   Ultimately while I think the devs have in the past spoken a bit dismissive of the community concerns, the game itself is ultimately a very solid experience and very worth buying if this is your cup of tea.

I thumbs up this game with a VERY hefty reservation.

The concept is brilliant, and games with friends can be a blast, BUT, the execution of the game has been less then stellar. Survivors have been nerfed into balanced ratio, whereas with the release of the nurse, now we have a lack of good survivor teams to go around, as all killers who haven't just started can play nurse and take teams apart like abstract art.

AKA with the plans to differentiate and buff the nurse, they inadvertedly broke the game and allowed any killer to guarantee two kills a game, giving them a point up their ranking every time. I legitimately cannot tell if a player is a hacker or not UNTIL i see their rank, then I know.

Within the week, this will likely be fixed, but be prepared for BS scenarios until they fix this.

This game has the chance of being a pretty good game. It however suffers from horrible balance. Most perks are not worth picking up at all, while a select few are too good to pass up, leaving room for very little customization. Hiding from a killer is pointless as any smart one will not be lost thanks to all the clues they get, not to mention survivors don't get anything to really help them hide. With the new auto aim you can't even try to juke a killer as they will just lock on to you so getting caught is a 99.9% chance of getting hooked. Thankfully hook camping is a thing so the chance of anybody even coming to save you is zero. 

This game is in desperate need of a balance patch to improve the selection of both killer and survivor perks. The fact that some perks are required only hurts new players, as they will have to grind out games against higher rank killers while they lack the tools needed to even survive. Until the developers show a little more care into proper balancing this game is a must avoid as it is just a mix of frustration through glitches, poorly executed features, hook camping, infinite juke spots, messy connectivity, poorly balanced perks, etc.
крутая игра очень отмосферная тока вот бы получить еще на совсем бесплатно ! )))

Ce jeu rqppelle férocement les horror movies des années 70-80, à ambiance glauque. Ya du slash, du sang, des cris, des gens qui courrent pour sauver leur peau, dans des décors bien dégueus et sombres. 
On peut incarner un survivant ou l'un des tueurs qui rappellent des "archétypes"/méchants de ces films : le mec à la tronçonneuse, le fantôme flippant, l'infirmière sournoise, le taré avec des pièges. C'est vraiment "jouissif" de jouer un de ces psychopathes. Courir après des petits lapins pas si crétins...
Les survivants sont au nombre de 4 avec leur propres spécificités : sabotage, soin,... L'arbre des compétences de tous évolue à chaque niveau. 
Le but est pour le tueur d'occire les 4 survivants avant qu'ils n'arrivent à s'enfuir. 
Ce jeu est néanmoins perfectible. Mais est vraiment bien en l'état... Les devs y apportent régulièrement des patches et un contenu gratuit vient de sortir... 
Les seuls bémols, il faut être en QWERTY pour jouer. Et il faudrait peut-être varier la façon dont les survivants se barrent. Car c'est toujours la même chose : réparer des moteurs pour ouvrir les portes de chaque map.
